body:
This [commit](https://github.com/temporalio/temporal/pull/136/commits/6c47ca7d0a499efa319a7120acca222dd93aa971) reverted an upgrade to gocql `v0.0.0-20200203083758-81b8263d9fe5` back to `v0.0.0-20171220143535-56a164ee9f31` which fixed an issue with paging behavior seen after the upgrade. Here is the buildkite [before](https://buildkite.com/temporal/temporal-server/builds/272) and [after](https://buildkite.com/temporal/temporal-server/builds/273) the revert.

We're unfortunately using a quite old version of gocql, so I need to investigate further on what the behavioral difference is and if there are any release notes or published changes in the past 3 years in this area.
title: Investigate why upgrading gocql breaks paging
